name: Shai Framework
description: Comprehensive evaluation framework for blockchain projects with metrics for foundational strength, product, financials, strategic alignment, ecosystem health, and risk assessment.
author: Shai Perednik

categories.name: Foundational Metrics
categories.description: Objective indicators of a project's baseline strength and viability.

metrics.name: Funding
metrics.description: Indicates investor confidence and resources available for sustained growth.
metrics.importance: Strong correlation between a project's funding level and its strategic viability.

metrics.name: Team Experience
metrics.description: Assesses the relevant expertise and track record of founders and leadership.
metrics.importance: Experienced teams are better equipped to navigate complexities and execute effectively.

thresholds.T0: Founders and leadership have at least 5 years of relevant blockchain or industry-specific experience
thresholds.T1: Limited or irrelevant experience among founders and leadership

metrics.name: Team Diversity
metrics.description: Evaluates the geographical and functional diversity of the team.
metrics.importance: Diverse teams bring varied perspectives, promote innovation, and increase adaptability.

thresholds.T0: Teams representing at least 3 different countries or spanning at least 2 continents
thresholds.T1: Teams from fewer than 3 countries or restricted to a single continent

metrics.name: GitHub Activity
metrics.description: Measures development activity, transparency, and community engagement.
metrics.importance: Active code repositories indicate robust development and community engagement.

thresholds.T0: Consistently high activity with at least 20 commits per month, active engagement across 5+ repositories
thresholds.T1: Low activity, less than 10 commits per month, limited repository engagement

metrics.name: Advisors & VC Backing
metrics.description: Evaluates the quality and credibility of advisors and investors.
metrics.importance: Top-tier backing enhances credibility, strategic alignment, and resource availability.

thresholds.T0: High-quality advisors with proven track records and clear Tier-1 venture capital involvement
thresholds.T1: Advisors with limited track records or involvement of non-Tier-1 venture capital

categories.name: Product Metrics
categories.description: Quantitative measures of a project's product strength and market acceptance.

metrics.name: Product-Market Fit (PMF)
metrics.description: Assesses how well the product meets market needs and achieves adoption.
metrics.importance: High PMF indicates strong market acceptance and long-term viability.

thresholds.T0: ≥50,000 active users, >70% monthly retention, ≥20% MoM growth
thresholds.T1: <50,000 active users, <40% monthly retention, ≤5% MoM growth

metrics.name: Composability & Interoperability
metrics.description: Measures integration potential with other protocols and standards.
metrics.importance: Projects with high composability are better positioned for ecosystem adoption.

thresholds.T0: Clear, proven integrations with at least 5 prominent Web3 protocols

metrics.name: Active User Projections
metrics.description: Evaluates the credibility and ambition of user adoption forecasts.
metrics.importance: Accurate, ambitious projections reflect strategic potential and market readiness.

thresholds.T0: User adoption projection of ≥50,000 users within the first year
thresholds.T1: User adoption projection of <50,000 users within the first year

categories.name: Financial Metrics
categories.description: Evaluates economic sustainability and the robustness of token design.

metrics.name: Tokenomics Structure
metrics.description: Assesses the sustainability of token distribution and economic model.
metrics.importance: Sustainable token economics ensure longevity and investor confidence.

thresholds.T0: Treasury reserves ≥25% of market cap, ≥25% stablecoin/fiat reserves
thresholds.T1: Treasury reserves <10% of market cap, <10% stablecoin/fiat reserves

metrics.name: Economic Viability
metrics.description: Measures the project's financial health and economic activity.
metrics.importance: High economic viability indicates robust adoption and strategic position.

thresholds.T0: TVL/Market Cap Ratio ≥0.5, Sustained ≥10% MoM growth
thresholds.T1: TVL/Market Cap Ratio <0.2, Stagnant or declining TVL

categories.name: Strategic Alignment Metrics
categories.description: Assesses positioning and leadership within specific industry verticals.

metrics.name: Vertical Leadership
metrics.description: Evaluates the project's competitive position in its industry vertical.
metrics.importance: Projects with clear industry leadership demonstrate strategic advantages.

thresholds.T0: Among the top 5 within a defined vertical
thresholds.T1: Outside top 5, emerging, or unclear positioning

tools: Industry Reports (Messari, Delphi Digital, The Block)

categories.name: Ecosystem & Community Metrics
categories.description: Quantifies the health and engagement of a project's community and ecosystem.

metrics.name: Network Effects
metrics.description: Measures the growth and interconnectedness of the project ecosystem.
metrics.importance: Strong network effects enhance strategic positioning and scalability.

thresholds.T0: ≥10 actively used protocols/dApps, >20% third-party developer contributions

metrics.name: Community Engagement
metrics.description: Assesses the activity and growth of the project's community.
metrics.importance: Active communities drive adoption, advocacy, and ecosystem involvement.

thresholds.T0: ≥5,000 active community members, consistent month-over-month growth
thresholds.T1: <1,000 active members, declining or static engagement

metrics.name: Strategic Partnerships
metrics.description: Evaluates the quality and impact of project partnerships.
metrics.importance: Strategic partnerships expand market reach and enhance credibility.

thresholds.T0: ≥3 significant partnerships actively contributing to adoption
thresholds.T1: ≤1 notable partnership or limited strategic impact

categories.name: Risk Metrics & Red Flags
categories.description: Identifies potential issues critical for BD professionals to assess.

metrics.name: Regulatory Risks
metrics.description: Assesses the regulatory clarity and compliance of the project.
metrics.importance: Regulatory clarity ensures long-term operational stability.

thresholds.T0: Operates in low-risk jurisdictions with established regulatory frameworks
thresholds.T1: Operates in high-risk jurisdictions or areas with ambiguous regulations

metrics.name: Token Liquidity
metrics.description: Measures the liquidity and trading activity of the project's token.
metrics.importance: Adequate liquidity ensures investor confidence and reduces manipulation risks.

thresholds.T0: High liquidity: >5% of circulating supply in daily trading volume
thresholds.T1: Low liquidity: <1% of circulating supply in daily trading volume

metrics.name: Runway & Burn Rate
metrics.description: Evaluates the project's financial sustainability and resources.
metrics.importance: Sustainable financial management enhances long-term viability.

thresholds.T0: Runway of 24+ months based on current burn rates and funding
thresholds.T1: Limited runway of 6 months or fewer
